description: Provides a way to un-obtrusively notify users of asynchronous events

provides.name: notification
provides.description: tells the notifier about a kind of notification that may be presented to the user. This will be used in a notification configuration user interface, for example.

params.name: name
params.description: name of the notification type. Notifications are identified by the combination of pluginName_notificationName, so you don't need to worry about making this unique across Bespin.

params.name: description
params.description: The more human-readable form of the notification name that will be presented to the user.

params.name: level
params.description: default level for these notifications. Value should be 'error', 'info' or 'debug'.

params.name: onclick
params.description: function that should be called if one of these notifications is clicked on. Will be passed the message object.

params.name: iconUrl
params.description: custom icon for this notification. looked up relative to the plugins resources directory.

provides.name: notificationHandler
provides.description: A function that is called with message objects whenever appropriate notifications are published.

params.name: name
params.description: convenient name for the handler (used in configuration)

params.name: description
params.description: Longer, more human-readable description of the handler

params.name: pointer
params.description: function that will be called with the message

provides.name: notifications
provides.description: JSON array of objects describing how notifications are configured
